biotools.summary: Genome segmentation with hidden Markov models has become a useful tool to annotate genomic elements, such as promoters and enhancers. The tool implements (bidirectional) hidden Markov models (HMMs) using a variety of different probability distributions, which can model a wide range of current genomic data. It de novo learns and annotates the genome into a given number of 'genomic states'. It also allows for the integration of strand-specific and non-strand-specific data.
